title: Python Coding Classes
audience: Students in grades 5-12 who are ready to start programming.
summary: Python is the best language to start with and powers data, AI, robotics, and web projects.
fullDescription: Beginner-friendly weekly classes that introduce core programming concepts in Python with a clear path into advanced curriculum.

title: Java Coding Classes
audience: Students who want industry-level Java skills, including AP Computer Science prep.
summary: For students of all levels who want to learn industry-level Java programming.
fullDescription: Weekly Java sessions build software engineering fundamentals, preparing learners for AP CS exams and real-world software work.

title: Free Tech Club
audience: Students seeking free exploratory classes offered at schools and libraries across San Diego.
summary: Learn Python, Java, AI, robotics, and more at no-cost Tech Club classes offered multiple times per week.
fullDescription: Community-based Tech Club sessions introduce emerging technologies, inspire interest in STEM, and provide ongoing practice without tuition fees.

title: Private Classes
audience: Learners who need individualized pacing or extra support with tailored mentorship.
summary: One-on-one virtual instruction tailored to the student with weekly 90-minute sessions.
fullDescription: Private classes pair students directly with League instructors for custom projects, targeted coaching, and flexible scheduling.

title: Seasonal Coding Camps
audience: Students looking for immersive seasonal camps during school breaks.
summary: Week-long, weekend, and afterschool camps that dive into varied programming topics.
fullDescription: Seasonal intensives deliver hands-on projects in Python, Java, AI, and more during spring, summer, and winter school breaks.
